column4: Hi. I am having difficulty using dpkg-divert to resolve a conflict. I am using Envy to install the latest ati catalyst drivers on 64-bit Ubuntu. When I run envy, it tries to install the package that it just built, and can't install it because there is a conflict with /usr/lib32/libGL.so.1, which is also provided by ia32-libs
ok, forget about the fact that I am using envy. Can someone explain just how to use dpkg-divert in my situation?
hard to forget it when you just said it and this channel does not support it
may as well uninstall the envy and the ati drivers and get them from the restricted drivers manager
